definitions.definition: To cause two or more events or actions to happen at exactly the same time or same rate , or in a time-coordinated way.

subdefinitions.definition: To occur at the same time or with coordinated timing.
To cause ( video and audio ) to play in a coordinated way.

definitions.definition: To set (a clock or watch ) to display the same time as another.
examples: We synchronized our watches and agreed to meet at four o'clock precisely.

definitions.definition: To cause (a set of files , data , or settings ) on one computer or device to be (and try to remain) the same as on another.
To agree , be coordinated with, or complement well.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To cause two or more events or actions to happen at exactly the same time or same rate , or in a time-coordinated way.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To set (a clock or watch ) to display the same time as another.
( computing , ambitransitive ) To cause (a set of files , data , or settings ) on one computer or device to be (and try to remain) the same as on another.
( intransitive , of inanimate entities ) To agree , be coordinated with, or complement well.
